channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Multiwinner Temporal Voting with Aversion to Change
item.description: We study two-stage committee elections where voters have dynamic preferences over candidates; at each stage, a committee is chosen under a given voting rule.

item.title: Large Language Models for Multimodal Deformable Image Registration
item.description: Specifically, we first utilize a CNN encoder to extract deep visual features from cross-modal image pairs, then we use the first adapter to adjust these tokens, and use LoRA in pre-trained LLMs to fine-tune their weights, both aimed at eliminating the domain gap between the pre-trained LLMs and the MDIR task.

item.title: Does Current Deepfake Audio Detection Model Effectively Detect ALM-based Deepfake Audio?
item.description: Currently, Audio Language Models (ALMs) are rapidly advancing due to the developments in large language models and audio neural codecs.

item.title: OpenScan: A Benchmark for Generalized Open-Vocabulary 3D Scene Understanding
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a more challenging task called Generalized Open-Vocabulary 3D Scene Understanding (GOV-3D) to explore the open vocabulary problem beyond object classes.

item.title: ETGuard: Malicious Encrypted Traffic Detection in Blockchain-based Power Grid Systems
item.description: The escalating prevalence of encryption protocols has led to a concomitant surge in the number of malicious attacks that hide in encrypted traffic.

item.title: Language Modeling on Tabular Data: A Survey of Foundations, Techniques and Evolution
item.description: This paper fills this gap by providing a systematic review of the development of language modeling for tabular data, encompassing: (1) a categorization of different tabular data structures and data types; (2) a review of key datasets used in model training and tasks used for evaluation; (3) a summary of modeling techniques including widely-adopted data processing methods, popular architectures, and training objectives; (4) the evolution from adapting traditional Pre-training/Pre-trained language models to the utilization of large language models; (5) an identification of persistent challenges and potential future research directions in language modeling for tabular data analysis.

item.title: Wave-Mask/Mix: Exploring Wavelet-Based Augmentations for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: This research introduces two augmentation approaches using the discrete wavelet transform (DWT) to adjust frequency elements while preserving temporal dependencies in time series data.

item.title: Hokoff: Real Game Dataset from Honor of Kings and its Offline Reinforcement Learning Benchmarks
item.description: The advancement of Offline Reinforcement Learning (RL) and Offline Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning (MARL) critically depends on the availability of high-quality, pre-collected offline datasets that represent real-world complexities and practical applications.

item.title: HiRED: Attention-Guided Token Dropping for Efficient Inference of High-Resolution Vision-Language Models in Resource-Constrained Environments
item.description: Then, using the attention in the final layer, we select the most important visual tokens from each partition within the allocated budget, dropping the rest.

item.title: Representation Norm Amplification for Out-of-Distribution Detection in Long-Tail Learning
item.description: The main idea is to use the norm of the representation as a new dimension for OOD detection, and to develop a training method that generates a noticeable discrepancy in the representation norm between ID and OOD data, while not perturbing the feature learning for ID classification.

item.title: FLAME: Learning to Navigate with Multimodal LLM in Urban Environments
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated potential in Vision-and-Language Navigation (VLN) tasks, yet current applications face challenges.

item.title: deepmriprep: Voxel-based Morphometry (VBM) Preprocessing via Deep Neural Networks
item.description: Voxel-based Morphometry (VBM) has emerged as a powerful approach in neuroimaging research, utilized in over 7, 000 studies since the year 2000.

item.title: ViLReF: A Chinese Vision-Language Retinal Foundation Model
item.description: The experimental results demonstrate the powerful zero-shot and transfer learning capabilities of ViLReF, verifying the effectiveness of our pre-training strategy.

item.title: Subspace Prototype Guidance for Mitigating Class Imbalance in Point Cloud Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Specifically, the point cloud is initially separated into independent point sets by category to provide initial conditions for the generation of feature subspaces.

item.title: Hologram Reasoning for Solving Algebra Problems with Geometry Diagrams
item.description: To reach this goal, it first defines a hologram, being a kind of graph, and proposes a hologram generator to convert a given APGD into a hologram, which represents the entire information of APGD and the relations for solving the problem can be acquired from it by a uniform way.

item.title: SZTU-CMU at MER2024: Improving Emotion-LLaMA with Conv-Attention for Multimodal Emotion Recognition
item.description: This paper presents our winning approach for the MER-NOISE and MER-OV tracks of the MER2024 Challenge on multimodal emotion recognition.

item.title: Ferret: Faster and Effective Automated Red Teaming with Reward-Based Scoring Technique
item.description: To overcome these limitations, we propose Ferret, a novel approach that builds upon Rainbow Teaming by generating multiple adversarial prompt mutations per iteration and using a scoring function to rank and select the most effective adversarial prompt.

item.title: Generalizable Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: To preserve the generalization ability of CLIP and the high precision of the FER model, we design a novel approach that learns sigmoid masks based on the fixed CLIP face features to extract expression features.

item.title: PRformer: Pyramidal Recurrent Transformer for Multivariate Time Series Forecasting
item.description: The self-attention mechanism in Transformer architecture, invariant to sequence order, necessitates positional embeddings to encode temporal order in time series prediction.

item.title: Accelerating Goal-Conditioned RL Algorithms and Research
item.description: Self-supervision has the potential to transform reinforcement learning (RL), paralleling the breakthroughs it has enabled in other areas of machine learning.

item.title: Putting People in LLMs' Shoes: Generating Better Answers via Question Rewriter
item.description: By enhancing the intelligibility of human questions for black-box LLMs, our question rewriter improves the quality of generated answers.

item.title: Recurrent Neural Networks Learn to Store and Generate Sequences using Non-Linear Representations
item.description: In this paper, we present a counterexample to this strong LRH: when trained to repeat an input token sequence, gated recurrent neural networks (RNNs) learn to represent the token at each position with a particular order of magnitude, rather than a direction.

item.title: Variable Assignment Invariant Neural Networks for Learning Logic Programs
item.description: Learning from interpretation transition (LFIT) is a framework for learning rules from observed state transitions.

item.title: Universal Novelty Detection Through Adaptive Contrastive Learning
item.description: More precisely, for novelty detection, distribution shifts may occur in the training set or the test set.

item.title: Prompt-Guided Image-Adaptive Neural Implicit Lookup Tables for Interpretable Image Enhancement
item.description: In this paper, we delve into the concept of interpretable image enhancement, a technique that enhances image quality by adjusting filter parameters with easily understandable names such as "Exposure" and "Contrast".

item.title: AnyGraph: Graph Foundation Model in the Wild
item.description: Furthermore, we have validated the model's fast adaptation ability and scaling law emergence, showcasing its versatility.

item.title: PerturBench: Benchmarking Machine Learning Models for Cellular Perturbation Analysis
item.description: We present a comprehensive framework for predicting the effects of perturbations in single cells, designed to standardize benchmarking in this rapidly evolving field.

item.title: EdgeNAT: Transformer for Efficient Edge Detection
item.description: On the one hand, EdgeNAT captures global contextual information and detailed local cues with DiNAT, on the other hand, it enhances feature representation with a novel SCAF-MLA decoder by utilizing both inter-spatial and inter-channel relationships of feature maps.

item.title: SysBench: Can Large Language Models Follow System Messages?
item.description: In order to enable effective evaluation, SysBench constructs multi-turn user conversations covering various interaction relationships, based on six common types of constraints from system messages in real-world scenarios.

item.title: Vision Calorimeter for Anti-neutron Reconstruction: A Baseline
item.description: In this study, we introduce Vision Calorimeter (ViC), a baseline method for anti-neutron reconstruction that leverages deep learning detectors to analyze the implicit relationships between EMC responses and incident $\bar{n}$ characteristics.

item.title: Atmospheric Transport Modeling of CO$_2$ with Neural Networks
item.description: Accurately describing the distribution of CO$_2$ in the atmosphere with atmospheric tracer transport models is essential for greenhouse gas monitoring and verification support systems to aid implementation of international climate agreements.

item.title: REInstruct: Building Instruction Data from Unlabeled Corpus
item.description: Manually annotating instruction data for large language models is difficult, costly, and hard to scale.

item.title: DAAD: Dynamic Analysis and Adaptive Discriminator for Fake News Detection
item.description: In current web environment, fake news spreads rapidly across online social networks, posing serious threats to society.

item.title: While GitHub Copilot Excels at Coding, Does It Ensure Responsible Output?
item.description: The rapid development of large language models (LLMs) has significantly advanced code completion capabilities, giving rise to a new generation of LLM-based Code Completion Tools (LCCTs).

item.title: Evaluation Framework for AI-driven Molecular Design of Multi-target Drugs: Brain Diseases as a Case Study
item.description: Additionally, this work will assess the performance of four deep generative models and evolutionary algorithms over our benchmark suite.

item.title: A toolbox for calculating objective image properties in aesthetics research
item.description: In the Toolbox, we integrated the original scripts of four different research groups and translated them into Python 3.

item.title: UIE-UnFold: Deep Unfolding Network with Color Priors and Vision Transformer for Underwater Image Enhancement
item.description: By explicitly incorporating color priors and modeling the physical characteristics of underwater image formation, the proposed DUN model achieves more accurate and reliable enhancement results.

item.title: CodeJudge-Eval: Can Large Language Models be Good Judges in Code Understanding?
item.description: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) have showcased impressive code generation capabilities, primarily evaluated through language-to-code benchmarks.

item.title: MPL: Lifting 3D Human Pose from Multi-view 2D Poses
item.description: Estimating 3D human poses from 2D images is challenging due to occlusions and projective acquisition.

item.title: Knowledge Sharing and Transfer via Centralized Reward Agent for Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Reward shaping is effective in addressing the sparse-reward challenge in reinforcement learning by providing immediate feedback through auxiliary informative rewards.

item.title: Second-Order Forward-Mode Automatic Differentiation for Optimization
item.description: This paper introduces a second-order hyperplane search, a novel optimization step that generalizes a second-order line search from a line to a $k$-dimensional hyperplane.

item.title: Meta-Learning on Augmented Gene Expression Profiles for Enhanced Lung Cancer Detection
item.description: We apply this framework to well-established deep learning methodologies and employ four distinct datasets for the meta-learning tasks, where one as the target dataset and the rest as source datasets.

item.title: SAM-UNet:Enhancing Zero-Shot Segmentation of SAM for Universal Medical Images
item.description: We train SAM-UNet on SA-Med2D-16M, the largest 2-dimensional medical image segmentation dataset to date, yielding a universal pretrained model for medical images.

item.title: SMILE: Zero-Shot Sparse Mixture of Low-Rank Experts Construction From Pre-Trained Foundation Models
item.description: Deep model training on extensive datasets is increasingly becoming cost-prohibitive, prompting the widespread adoption of deep model fusion techniques to leverage knowledge from pre-existing models.

item.title: TDNetGen: Empowering Complex Network Resilience Prediction with Generative Augmentation of Topology and Dynamics
item.description: Predicting the resilience of complex networks, which represents the ability to retain fundamental functionality amidst external perturbations or internal failures, plays a critical role in understanding and improving real-world complex systems.

item.title: NeuFlow v2: High-Efficiency Optical Flow Estimation on Edge Devices
item.description: In this paper, we propose a highly efficient optical flow method that balances high accuracy with reduced computational demands.

item.title: Implicit Grid Convolution for Multi-Scale Image Super-Resolution
item.description: We use a single encoder to extract features and introduce a novel upsampler, Implicit Grid Convolution~(IGConv), which integrates SPConv at all scales within a single module to predict multiple scales.

item.title: Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning for Autonomous Driving: A Survey
item.description: Reinforcement Learning (RL) is a potent tool for sequential decision-making and has achieved performance surpassing human capabilities across many challenging real-world tasks.

item.title: ExpoMamba: Exploiting Frequency SSM Blocks for Efficient and Effective Image Enhancement
item.description: Low-light image enhancement remains a challenging task in computer vision, with existing state-of-the-art models often limited by hardware constraints and computational inefficiencies, particularly in handling high-resolution images.

item.title: Deep-MacroFin: Informed Equilibrium Neural Network for Continuous Time Economic Models
item.description: In this paper, we present Deep-MacroFin, a comprehensive framework designed to solve partial differential equations, with a particular focus on models in continuous time economics.
